<<<<<<< HEAD
Considerations upon the reputation, loyalty, manners, & religion of Thomas Hobbes of Malmsbury written by himself, by way of letter to a learned person. Mr. Hobbes considered in his loyalty, religion, reputation and manners Hobbes, Thomas, 1588-1679.
[8], 3-63, [9] p.
Printed for William Crooke ..., London : 1680.
In answer to: Hobbius Heuton-timorumenos, or a consideration of Mr. Hobbs his dialogues / John Wallis. 1662. First published in 1662 with title: Mr. Hobbes considered in his loyalty, religion, reputation, and manners, by way of a letter to Dr. Wallis. Advertisements ([9] p.) at end. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
Considerations upon the reputation, loyalty, manners, & religion of Thomas Hobbes of Malmsbury written by himself, by way of letter to a learned person. Mr. Hobbes considered in his loyalty, religion, reputation and manners Hobbes, Thomas, 1588-1679.
[8], 3-63, [9] p.
Printed for William Crooke ..., London : 1680.
In answer to: Hobbius Heuton-timorumenos, or a consideration of Mr. Hobbs his dialogues / John Wallis. 1662. First published in 1662 with title: Mr. Hobbes considered in his loyalty, religion, reputation, and manners, by way of a letter to Dr. Wallis. Advertisements ([9] p.) at end. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
